revised_title: Ancient and Modern Observations of Electrical Phenomena
tldr: The author discusses historical accounts of electrical phenomena, including observations by ancient authors like Theophrastus, Plutarch, and Pliny, as well as modern accounts by William Watson and Thomas Birch. The text also mentions an observation by Fynes Moryson during the siege of Kingsale in 1601, where horsemen reportedly saw lamps burning at the points of their staves during lightning flashes.
